description: round island in street at left; two figures (children?) seen from back at right on island, leaning over wall; woman and figure in dark outfit and pointed cap, sitting beneath umbrella, on top step of island; three standing figures at left; wagon and white horse at center left; buildings in background; some light sketchy scenes in URQ and LRC
inscription:
Signature, Title, Inscription and Stamp

LLC, in the plate: [(man\'s face) Etat (illegible)]; LLQ in bottom margin, in the plate: [EPREWE / F/B / (horse and figure) / DAR (illegible)]; bottom center, in the plate: [(illegible) Paris chez l\' (illegible)]; on back, in pencil: [B3195-35], [APG 12735] and [MK 23868]
markings: on back, stamped in black: [COLLECTION / HENRI BERALDI]
provenance: H. Beraldi, Lugt 230 (1849-1931), Paris. [C. & J. Goodfriend, New York, until 2002; sold in September for TOOO, to Harry Drake]; Harry Drake, St. Paul (2002-d. 2012; bequeathed to MIA)
signed: LLC, in the plate: [Felix Buhot pinx-sc.]; bottom center, in the plate: [La Place Pigalle en 1878]
title: The Place Pigalle in 1878
